result.execSummary:
The defendant Bronson D. Hughes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex Offender - Fail/Update Information, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(4)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Bronson D. Hughes in court with attorney Roger L. Klopp.  Defendant Bronson D. Hughes in custody.  Kevin Calkins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and State states appearances and agreement on the record.  Atty Klopp agrees and NC plea entered.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on plea/accepts/finds guilty.  State makes statement.  Atty Klopp makes statement.  DE makes statement.  Court admonishes DE and sentences.  DE advised of felony firearm warnings, voting rights and appeal rights.

Ct 1:  NC
9 months jail w/huber consecutive to any other sentence
203 days credit for TIME SERVED sentence
Costs of $568.00 to be paid w/in 60 days or set up payment plan
DNA sample to be provided unless one has previously been provided in another matter
Status conference on December 29, 2014 at 10:45 am.
Public Defender appointment

Defendant Bronson D. Hughes in court, in custody.  Kevin R. Calkins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and State states appearances.  State notes DE's motion re: communications.  Court addresses upcoming JT for 11/4/2014.  Court questions DE re: what he is doing to obtain counsel.  DE responds/states he is seeking counsel.  Court explains process for requesting attorney through public defender's office again.  DE wishes to pursue that right.  Court states he will adjourn the JT so DE can speak to an attorney.  DE wants to have the FPT changed to a regular PTC.  Court will reset all matters at this time so DE can talk to his attorney when one is appointed.  Court takes all matters off of calendar, including today's motion hearing and they will all be reset when an attorney is appointed.  Court is adjourned.  Bond continued.
to intercept oral communication
Motion hearing on October 20, 2014 at 02:45 pm.
from defendant
Final pre-trial on October 27, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
Jury trial on November 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Bronson D. Hughes in court, in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Rec'd copy of INFO/waived reading.    Court enters Not Guilty plea- Set for Trial Br. 2. Bond continues.
2 Page letter from DE to the Court
from Judge Taggart to DE
Arraignment on September 5, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Bronson D. Hughes in court, in custody.  Kevin Calkins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and State states appearances and status.  Court questions DE on waiver of counsel/wants written waiver of counsel.  Court recesses for DE to fill out right to attorney waiver if he wishes to do so.  Back on the record, the Court questions DE on attorney waiver/accepts.  State calls Valerie Santana - DOC - S&T.  Witness ID's DE.  Record to reflect ID of DE.  State continues direct.  DE does cross-exam.  No re-direct.  Witness excused.  DE has no witnesses.  State makes brief argument.  DE responds.  Court finds probable cause to believe the DE has commited a felony and binds the matter over.  Bond continued.  State files information and Court sets matter for arraignment at the request of the DE.  Arraignment scheduled for September 5, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
from DE to the Court
Preliminary hearing on August 29, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Bronson D. Hughes in court, in custody, w/o counsel.  Kevin R. Calkins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Here to see if DE wants to proceed pro se or go thru PD's office.  Court advises right to atty. DE decides to proceed pro se.  Court will allow to proceed on own.  Matter not resolved.  Reset for preliminary hearing.  Time limits continued waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 29, 2014 at 10:00 am.
letter fro DE
to withdraw atty.
Return date on August 8, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Bronson D. Hughes in court with attorney Peter Michael Masana.  Defendant Bronson D. Hughes in custody.  Kevin R. Calkins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and State states appearances and status.  DE to waive prelim today and proceed to arraignment.  Atty Masana agrees.  Court notes two letters just received from the DE in the last day or two.  DE makes statement re: counsel.  Says he wants to go pro se on this matter.  Atty Masana moves to withdraw the prelim waiver form as the DE has now stated he wishes to proceed pro se.  Atty Calkins isn't objecting to the Court allowing Atty Masana to withdraw.  Court finds attorney/client relationship has broken down and will allow Atty Masana to withdraw as counsel.  Atty Masana to prepare and order for the Court to sign.  WOPH form given back to DE and Court advises DE to speak to the PD's office re: possibly getting new counsel.  Atty Calkins requests reset RD for next week to check the status on this matter.  Court finds good reason for continuance of time limit waiver.  Bond continued.  Return date scheduled for August 8, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
Letter from DE to Judge Reynolds
Cover Letter from Defendant to Court
Preliminary hearing on August 1, 2014 at 10:45 am.

Defendant Bronson D. Hughes in court with attorney Peter Michael Masana.  Defendant Bronson D. Hughes in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Issues with representation.  Defendant request Attorney Masana.  Attorney Masana request preliminary hearing.  Bond continues.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 1, 2014 at 10:45 am.
Return date on July 24, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Pre-trial conference on July 11, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Return date on July 22, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Bronson D. Hughes by video from LEC with attorney Debra V O'Rourke.  Defendant Bronson D. Hughes in custody.  Sue M Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense waives reading of complaint.  State requests cash bond.  Atty O'Rourke responds/DE does qualify for PD appt.  Advised rights to an attorney.  Requests Preliminary hearing; Time limits waived.  $2,500.00 cash bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  Not to leave the State of Wisconsin.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 11, 2014 at 09:00 am.  Return date scheduled for July 22, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
